creditline: Gift of Ruth Lathrop Sikes in memory of her brother Bruce Sikes, 1967
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Eight Views of Elegant Women of the Brothels (Fūryū seirō meifu hakkei 風流青楼名婦八景)
provenance: Frank Loyd Wright; Edward Burr Van Vleck; Ruth Lathrop Sikes (until 1967)
text: This print is a mitate (visual parody) on the classical Chinese theme of the Eight Views of the Xiao and Xiang Rivers. It is one of a series that depicts popular prostitutes in scenes that allude to the eight views. Here, the prostitute Segawa and her attendant are playing the shamisen while returning boats—the theme of one of the views—can be seen in the background.
title: Segawa of the Matsubaya: Returning Sails
